intro: Saussurea dzeurensis, commonly known as the Tibetan yellowhead, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and yellow-orange flower heads. The plant thrives in cold, arid environments and is often found in alpine meadows at elevations above 3,000 meters. Its medicinal properties have been recognized in traditional Tibetan medicine, where it is used to treat various ailments. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
